column1: An organism is any living thing. It is easy to recognise a living thing
column2: but not so easy to define it. Animals and plants are organisms
column5: part of the environment. Rocks and sunshine are parts of the non-living environment. Organisms usually have five basic needs. They need air
column8: energy and a place to live. However
column9: not all living things need all these at the same time. Many organisms do not need access to air at all. A little thought is needed about viruses. There is no agreement as to whether they should be regarded as living. They are made of protein and nucleic acid
column11: which is a really important fact. However
column12: they exist in two quite different phases. One phase is dormant
column13: not active. The other is inside a living cell of some other organism. Then the virus is very active reproducing itself.
